text: (upbeat music)

- My name is Ben Wilson and I
work for Elastic Block Store.

I am a systems development
engineer and I've been at Amazon
for a little over five years.

I started out with a biology
degree doing research

and I ended up finding that
the kinda tech side of that,

'cause it was the group
that did data warehousing,

was a lot more interesting
than the actual research part.
And I ended up switching jobs and working

at like a help desk and then
ended up moving out here

to Boston and then finally
decided to see what was going on

at Amazon since they
had some offices here.
(upbeat music)

I was attracted to AWS because
one of the job openings

was for Elastic File
System, which was a bit
of a dream product to work on.

It was something I was
very interested in using

at previous jobs 'cause it
solved a lot of problems I had.

I was a little bit worried
about working for Amazon
just 'cause I had heard it had, you know,
a bit of a tough culture.

And it turns out that I
would describe this job
as more stressful but less frustrating

than my previous jobs
because what we do here
actually matters to people in a big way.

It's one of the cool
parts about working here
is you get to see how the sausage is made.
And part of that is watching the sausage
get cooked occasionally.
(upbeat music)
